headline: FEMA will spend $8.6M to build flood control basin in Nogales area
author: Paul Ingram
sentences: During rainstorms, vast amounts of water moves through the Nogales Wash and Potrero Creek, and in recent years, such flooding has compromised the structural integrity of the International Outfall Interceptor—a 30-inch-wide sewer trunk line carries 12-14 million gallons of raw sewage and runoff each day from Nogales, Sonora, and Nogales, Ariz., to a treatment plant near Rio Rico, as part of an international water treatment plan regulated by the International Boundary and Water Commission under a 1953 agreement.
